snp4.12:1.3: Here, as often in the Aṭṭhakavagga, _jānāti_ implies different ways of knowing, which may be right or wrong (to degrees). We can’t press “know” to serve this sense. I can have a different “understanding” to you, I can “see” it differently, but I can’t “know” it differently.
snp4.12:3.2: Preferring _omako_ over _mago_, which seems a little harsh; _omako_ conforms to the principle of least meaning.
